com.percussion.extension
Interface IPSResultDocumentProcessor

All Superinterfaces:
IPSExtension
All Known Subinterfaces:
IPSItemOutputTransformer, IPSItemValidator
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSAddAllowableWorkflowsForContentType, PSAddAllParamsToUrl, PSAddAssemblerInfo, PSAddChildInfo, PSAddCommunityEnabledFlag, PSAddDefaultCommunity, PSAddIsManagedNavUsed, PSAddNewItemToFolder, PSAddPluginProperties, PSAddServerProperties, PSAddUserControlsToTree, PSAppendUserRoles, PSAuthtypeDispatcher, PSAutoRelatedContent, PSCheckOutSlotItem, PSCleanupCrossSiteLiniks, PSCollapseHtmlParameter, PSContextMenu, PSCopySiteDef, PSCreateTranslations, PSDatabasePublisher, PSDeleteChildComponentRelations, PSDependencyTree, PSFilterContextMenu, PSFixAssemblyUrlForRevision, PSFormatFileTree, PSGetAadItemTypeIconPaths, PSGetAndSetCxOptions, PSGetInlineVariantBody, PSGetItemTypeIconPaths, PSGetModifiedInlineLinkData, PSGetRelationshipProps, PSIncrementalContentFilter, PSInlineImageSizeExtractor, PSInlineLinkCleanup, PSInsertAsRelatedItem, PSMenuTree, PSModifySiteDefs, PSParamsToXml, PSParamStringListToMultiParams, PSPublishEditionForPreview, PSReplaceResultDocument, PSSelectAASlots, PSServerUserSearch, PSSiteFolderAuthTypeFilter, PSTranslationKeyValueAccessor, PSXdCopyDom, PSXdDomToText, PSXdFileToTree, PSXdMultiTextToTree, PSXdRemoveElements, PSXdTextToDom, PSXdTextToTree, PSXdTransformDom, PSXdTransformDomToText
public interface IPSResultDocumentProcessor
extends IPSExtension

The IPSResultDocumentProcessor interface must be implemented by extensions which process the result document.

When Rhythmyx processes the request, it generates an XML document.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
Tas Giakouminakis

Method Detail

canModifyStyleSheet

boolean canModifyStyleSheet()
Is the processResultDocument method implemented by this class capable of modifying the style sheet? If the method can change the style sheet by setting the XML-stylesheet processing instruction, this method returns true. If the method never attempts to modify the XML-stylesheet processing instruction, this method returns false. This answer helps the designer understand the implications of calling this extension.

Returns:
true if the processResultDocument method may modify the XML-stylesheet processing instruction

processResultDocument

Document processResultDocument(Object[] params,
                               IPSRequestContext request,
                               Document resultDoc)
                               throws PSParameterMismatchException,
                                      PSExtensionProcessingException
Modifies the result document that will be returned to the requestor.

When Rhythmyx processes the request, it generates an XML document.

If certain nodes in the tree will be changed, but the overall structure is not changed, the document passed into this method should be returned. If an unrelated document is being built, or major structural changes are being made, it may be better to create a new XML document.

NOTE: The implementation of this method must be safe for multi-threaded use. One instance of the extension will be defined for each usage in an application. For example, if the application defines the same extension in five different cases of different data as input), five instances of this extension will be created. When processing requests, the same instance may be accessed for several threads, each with its own set of data. As such, any variables used during run-time execution should be defined within the method (not the class). Another alternative is to use variables of type java.lang.ThreadLocal to define thread specific copies of the variable.

Parameters:
params - the parameter values supplied with the request in the appropriate order
request - the request context object
resultDoc - the result XML document, can be null
Returns:
the processed document. If no changes are made, returns the resultDoc which was passed in. If null is returned, the HTTP status code 404, file not found, will be returned to the caller of this method.
Throws:
PSParameterMismatchException - if a call to setParamValues was never made, or the runtime parameters specified in that call are incorrect for the usage of this extension.
PSExtensionProcessorException - if any other exception occurs which prevents the proper handling of this request.
PSExtensionProcessingException
